title: Understanding Qualitative Analysis
text: Qualitative analysis is used to identify the presence of certain substances or components in a sample. It does not measure the quantity, but rather confirms the presence or absence of a particular substance.

title: Differentiating Analysis Types
text: In analytical chemistry, qualitative analysis focuses on identifying what is present in a sample, while quantitative analysis measures how much of a substance is present. Characterization involves understanding the properties of a substance, and fundamental analysis deals with basic principles.

title: Choosing the Right Analysis
text: Given that the task is to determine the presence of allergens, which type of analysis would be most appropriate?
